General_info: Hufflepuff student in Harry Potter's year. Prefect and member of Dumbledore's Army.
Member of Tom Riddle's gang when they attended Hogwarts, and was a member of the Slug Club

School friend of Severus Snape. After graduating from Hogwarts, he became a Death Eater. He participated in the First Wizarding War, but like most Death Eaters, didn't search for Lord Voldemort after his downfall, although he was forgiven after his master's return. During the Second Wizarding War, he fought at the Battle of the Department of Mysteries with a group of Death Eaters, attempting to take a prophecy from Harry Potter.
Head of the Department of Magical Games and Sports within the Ministry of Magic.

Author of A History of Magic, and the great aunt of Gellert Grindelwald. She lived in Godric's Hollow, and was murdered around December, 1997, after which her corpse was animated by Lord Voldemort to contain his pet snake Nagini.

Alegedly a member of the Dumbledore family, he was adopted by Barebone, leader of an ani-witchcraft society. Due to the repression of his magic, Credence developed a dark parasitic force known as an Obscurus and became an Obscurial. Grindelwald wanted to use this Obscurus force, in his battle against Albus Dumbledore.
Gryffindor Quidditch Chaser one year above Harry Potter. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
History of Magic professor.
Grandfather of Serius Black.

Mother of Arthur Weasley. Paternal grandfather of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron and Ginny Weasley, great-grandfather to James, Albus and Lily Potter, Victoire, Dominique, Louis, Molly II, Lucy, Fred and Roxanne Weasley and Rose and Hugo Granger-Weasley.
Mother of Walburga. Grandmother of Bellatrix, Narcissa and Andromeda. Wife of Pollux.
Great-great-grandfather of Sirius Black and former Hogwarts headmaster. His painting hangs in the office and assists the current headmaster.
Husband of Irma. Grandfather of Sirius Black.
Brother of Sirius Black. He defied Voldemort and found and intended to destroy Salazar Slytherin's locket (horcrux) and died when dragged into the lake and drowned by Voldemort's inferi.

Harry's godfather who was a close friend of Harry's father James. Escapee from Azkaban prison and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed in the Battle of the Department of Mysteries by his cousin Bellatrix Lestrange.
Mother of Sirius and Regulus Black. Her portrait hangs in Number 12, Grimmauld Place.
Her family owned a large chain of apothecaries.
Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement, and the aunt of Susan Bones. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Hufflepuff student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year and member of Dumbledore's Army. Killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Member of Dolores Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad.
Professor of Muggle Studies at Hogwarts. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Muggle gardener for the Riddle family. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Death Eater and sister of Amycus Carrow. Professor of Muggle Studies for one year, and Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts under Severus Snape.
Death Eater and brother of Alecto Carrow. Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts for one year, and Deputy Headmaster of Hogwarts under Snape.
She and her twin sister Hestia were underage to fight in the battle, they likely departed the school along with most other members of their house before the battle started.
Hestia and her twin sister Flora were present in the Great Hall prior to the Battle of Hogwarts when classmate Pansy Parkinson urged students to hand over Harry Potter to Lord Voldemort.
Employee of the Magical Maintenance Department for the Ministry of Magic. Impersonated by Ron Weasley.
Muggle-born wife of Reginald Cattermole. Saved by Harry Potter from the Muggle-born Registration Commission.
Ravenclaw Quidditch Seeker one year above Harry, and his first love interest. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Ravenclaw prefect and girlfriend of Percy Weasley.
Matron of the orphanage where Tom Riddle lived.
Wizard who wrote to the Daily Prophet advice page.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Death Eater and father of Vincent Crabbe.
Slytherin student in Harry's year and the son of a Death Eater. Slytherin Quidditch Beater and member of the Inquisitorial Squad. Killed by his own Fiendfyre spell.
Muggle-born Gryffindor student one year below Harry. Older brother of Dennis Creevey, and member of Dumbledore's Army. Killed during the Battle of Hogwarts.
Muggle-born Gryffindor student three years below Harry. Younger brother of Colin Creevey, and member of Dumbledore's Army.

Muggle-born Head of the Goblin Liaison Office. He was hunted by the Ministry of Magic and the Snatchers. He went on the run with fellow Muggle-borns Ted Tonks, Dean Thomas and goblins Gornuk and Griphook, during which he is killed.
Son of Dirk Cresswell. Became an Auror. Father of Isis Cresswell.
Daughter of Gabriel Cresswell. Classmate of Albus Severus Potter.
Brother of Gabriel Cresswell. Dolores Umbridge made him use a blood quill to write lines as punishment.
Barty Sr. Head of the Department of International Magical Cooperation. Killed by his son Barty Crouch Jr.
Barty Jr. Death Eater credited with facilitating the return of Lord Voldemort. Used Polyjuice Potion to impersonate Alastor Moody, and received a Dementor's Kiss.
Editor-in-chief of the Daily Prophet
Ravenclaw Quidditch Captain and Chaser. Attended Yule Ball with Fleur Delacour.

He was unflappable during conflicts and remained calm and generally unfazed by threats from his criminal enemies. He accompanied Cornelius Fudge in an failed attempt to arrest Dumbledore. After the Battle of the Department of Mysteries, Dawlish was one of the Aurors who arrived in the Ministry Atrium. During the course of the Second Wizarding War, however, Dawlish's powers were diminished somewhat as he was incapacitated and attacked quite frequently.
Participant in the Triwizard Tournament as a representative of wizarding school Beauxbatons. Later married Bill Weasley. Mother of Victoire Weasley.
Fleur's younger sister. Rescued by Harry during the Triwizard Tournament.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Member of the Order of the Phoenix who took the Dursleys into hiding.
Cedric Diggory's father. Employee of the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures.
Hufflepuff student and prefect two years above Harry. Quidditch Seeker and captain, and co-winner of the Triwizard Tournament. Killed by Peter Pettigrew on Lord Voldemort's command.
Professor at Hogwarts. Served as headmaster before Albus Dumbledore.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: School friend of Albus Dumbledore.
Death Eater who killed Fabian Prewett, Gideon Prewett, and Remus Lupin.
Brother of Albus and Ariana Dumbledore. Owner of the Hog's Head tavern.
Transfiguration professor in Tom Riddle's time and Hogwarts headmaster in Harry Potter's time. Founder of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed by Severus Snape on his own request.
Sister of Albus and Aberforth Dumbledore, killed in three-way duel between her brothers and Gellert Grindelwald.
Wife of Percival Dumbledore. Mother of Albus, Aberforth and Ariana Dumbledore.
Husband of Kendra Dumbledore, father of Albus, Aberforth and Ariana Dumbledore.
Muggle son of Vernon Dursley and Petunia Evans, first cousin of Harry Potter.
Muggle sister of Vernon Dursley.
Harry's aunt, and his mother Lily's sister.  Vernon's wife and Dudley's mother.
Harry Potter's Muggle uncle. Petunia's husband and Dudley's father.
Ravenclaw student one year above Harry. Member of Dumbledore's Army who later betrays the group to Dolores Umbridge.
Squib neighbor of the Dursleys. Member of the Order of the Phoenix.
Squib caretaker of Hogwarts.
Son of Justin Finch-Fletcher. Good friends with housemates Louis Weasley and Morgan Hallterman.
Muggle-born Hufflepuff student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army and best friend of housemate Dean Thomas. Became professor at Hogwarts.
Creator and owner of the Philosopher's Stone.
Opera singer. Horace Slughorn kept a picture of her in a Viking maiden costume on his shelf, which she had inscribed, "Best wishes".
Slytherin Quidditch captain.
Common thief and shifty Order of the Phoenix member.

Head of Ravenclaw House and Charms professor at Hogwarts. Flitwick was a duelling champion when he was young. He opposed Dolores Umbridge, the High Inquisitor of Hogwarts. Fought at the Battle of the Astronomy Tower. He also protected the students from the Carrows. He defeated many Death Eaters and survived the war. He continued to teach Charms at Hogwarts to future generations of students. Good friends with Minerva McGonagall.
Owner of Honeydukes sweetshop, a very popular shop among Hogwarts students during their weekend outtings in the village.
Ice cream vendor at Diagon Alley.
Minister for Magic in the first five books. Sacked after persistently denying Lord Voldemort's return.
The pure-blood father of Merope and Morfin Gaunt, and grandfather of Tom Marvolo Riddle.
Tom Riddle's mother who died in childbirth.
Marvolo's son and Merope's brother. Framed by his nephew Tom Riddle for Muggle killings, and died in Azkaban.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Porpentina. American witch. She attended Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where she was sorted into Thunderbird house. Sister of Queenie Goldstein. Newt Scamenders wife.
American half-Blood witch. She attended Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where she was sorted into Pukwudgie house. Younger sister of Tina Goldstein.
Death Eater and father of Gregory Goyle.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Slytherin Quidditch Beater and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.
Muggle-born Gryffindor student in Harry's year and one of his best friends. Prefect and co-founder of Dumbledore's Army.
Draco Malfoy's wife. Mother of Scorpius Malfoy. She died in 2019 due to her blood curse.
Sister of Astoria.
Highly regarded Eastern European wandmaker.
Fenrir Greyback – Werewolf working for the Death Eaters.

Former close friend and lover of Albus Dubledore. A dark wizard who was jailed in Nurmengard, after Albus Dumbledore defeated him in the 1940s. Owner of the Elder wand, before he lost it in the duel against Albus Dumbledore.
Wilhelmina Grubbly-Plank – Substitute Care of Magical Creatures professor during Harry's fourth and fifth years.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts. He was a very powerful wizard.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Half-giant wizard, son of the giantess Fridwulfa and elder half-brother of the giant Grawp. Hogwarts gamekeeper. Care of Magical Creatures professor starting in Harry's third year. Member of the Order of the Phoenix. As a Hogwarts student, he was expelled in his third year.
Hogwarts flying instructor and Quidditch referee.
Witch who works in the Ministry of Magic. Impersonated by Hermione Granger.
Founder of Hufflepuff House. Co-founder of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Ravenclaw chaser. Friends with Iris Cresswell and Irene Mcmillan.
Gryffindor student two years above Harry. Quidditch Chaser and later team captain.
Captain of the Holyhead Harpies.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Member of the Advance Guard, she later escorted the Dursleys from their home to a safe location, along with Dedalus Diggle.
Gryffindor student two years above Harry. Hogwarts Quidditch commentator and good friend of Fred and George Weasley.
Ministry of Magic employee that worked under the Department of Magical Games and Sports. Killed by Voldemort in order to create Nagini as the last horcrux.
Wife to both Mustafa Kama and mother to Yusuf Kama. She was put under the Imperius Curse by Corvus Lestrange and forcibly had a daughter with him. Laurena died after giving birth to Leta Lestrange.
French wizzard of Senegalese descent. Father Of Yusuf Kama.
French wizzard,son of Mustafa. Last male in his family line.
Reformed Death Eater. Headmaster of wizarding school Durmstrang.
Non-maji. Friend of Newt Scamander and boyfriend of Queenie Goldstein.
Bulgarian Quidditch Seeker and Durmstrang student who participated in the Triwizard Tournament.
Care of Magical Creatures teacher until Harry's third year.
He was a member of Tom Riddle's gang when they attended Hogwarts.During his time at school, Lestrange forgot to turn in a Potions essay for Professor Slughorn and was nearly put in detention.

Cousin of Sirius Black. Sister to Narcissa Malfoy and Andromeda Tonks. A Death Eater who tortured Neville Longbottom's parents Frank and Alice into insanity. She killed Serious Black. She was killed by Molly Weasley during the Battle of Hogwarts.
Second wife of Corvus Lestrange

Daughter of Corvus Lestrange and Laurena Kama. Newt Scamander's high school love. Fiancé of his borther, Theseus Scamander. She regarded herself guilty of unintentionally killing her brother. She was onboard the Titanic. She sacrificed herself, distracting Grindelwalt in Paris. Her demise inspired Newt Scamander to openly go to war against Grindelwald.
Death Eater. Brother of Rodolphus Lestrange.
Death Eater. Bellatrix's husband and Rabastan's brother.
Fraudulent celebrity author and Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. Lost his memory after a memory charm backfired and resided in St. Mungo's afterwards.
Neville Longbottom's mother. Auror and member of the original Order of the Phoenix. Tortured into insanity by Bellatrix Lestrange.
Frank's mother and Neville's grandmother, who raises him after his parents are incapacitated.
Neville Longbottom's Father. Auror and member of the original Order of the Phoenix. Tortured into insanity by Bellatrix Lestrange.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Xenophilius Lovegood's daughter and Ravenclaw student one year below Harry. Member of Dumbledore's Army and wife of Newt Scamander's grandson Rolf.
Luna's mother and Xenophilius' wife. She was an extraordinary witch who liked to experiment with spells and she died when her own spell backfired, when Luna was nine.
Luna's father. Editor of tabloid magazine The Quibbler.

Family_affiliation: Lupin family, Tonks family, Black family
General_info: Lycanthropic Gryffindor student before Harry's time who befriended Sirius Black and James Potter. Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts in Harry's third year, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. He and his wife Nymphadora Tonks gave birth to a son, Teddy, before dying in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Family_affiliation: Lupin family, Tonks family, Black family, Potter family
General_info: Edward Lupin. Son of Remus Lupin and Nymphadora Tonks. Harry Potter's godson. Boyfriend of Victoire Weasley.
Death Eater and Committee of Disposal of Dangerous Creatures' executioner. Injured badly by Hagrid during the Battle of Hogwarts.

Father of Lucius Malfoy, grandfather of Draco Malfoy and great-grandfather of Scorpius Malfoy. He was related by marriage to the Blacks, through his daughter-in-law Narcissa, and, more distantly, to the Lestranges. An old friend of Slughorn's.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Quidditch Seeker, prefect, and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.
Husband of Narcissa. Draco Malfoy's father. Respected high-ranking Ministry of Magic official. Governor of Hogwarts early in the series. Influential Death Eater.
Lucius' wife and Draco's mother. Sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Andromeda Tonks. Cousin of Sirius Black.
Son of Draco Malfoy and Astoria Greengrass. Sorted into Slytherin. Friends with Albus Potter.
Clothing shop owner in Diagon Alley.

Governor of the Wizarding Examinations Authority which ran the O.W.L, N.E.W.T., and W.O.M.B.A.T. exams. Wizengamot elder. She was a friend and supporter of Albus Dumbledore, impressed by his incredible magical talents. According to Neville Longbottom, she was a tough and strict woman much like his grandmother.
French half-giant witch. Headmistress of Beauxbatons Academy of Magic.
Younger brother of Minerva McGonagall. Malcolm eventually fathered at least one child. His offspring would often visit his sister's home in Hogsmeade during her brief marriage.

Family_affiliation: McGonagall family, Ross family, Urquart family
General_info: Hogwarts Transfiguration professor. Head of Gryffindor House. Animagus. Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Assumes position of Hogwarts Headmaster for a time after Voldemort's death.
Muggle father of Minerva McGonagall.
Youngest brother of Minerva McGonagall. Fathered at least one child. Killed by Death Eaters during the height of the First Wizarding War.
He became assistant director of the Daily Prophet. Father of Irene.
Daughter of Ernest and Susan Bones. Sister of Justin.
Son of Ernest Mc Millan and Susan Bones. Brother of Irene. Named after Justin Finch-Fletchley, a close friend of his father.
Gryffindor student that accidentally removed her nose trying to get rid of her acne. Known for her bad case of acne.
Gryffindor student one year above Harry Potter. Quidditch Keeper and member of Horace Slughorn's Slug Club. His uncle Tiberius was well-connected within the Ministry of Magic.
Slytherin Quidditch Chaser who became trapped inside a Vanishing Cabinet for six months.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Retired Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Impersonated by Barty Crouch Jr. in his scheme to enter Harry into the Triwizard Tournament. Killed by Voldemort.

Maledictus cursed to transform into a snake form and belonged to Lord Voldemort, with whom she had a special bond largely due to becoming a Horcrux, after her master had killed Bertha Jorkins. She was killed by Neville Longbottom.

He was widely believed to have been the one who penned the Pure-Blood Directory. Some of the families presented in his apparent directory weren't as pure-blooded as he claimed, such as the Ollivander family. Also many pure-blooded families such as the Potters were not listed, in fact many pure-blood supremacists were angered by their lack of inclusion.
Slytherin student in the same year as Harry Potter.
Theodore Nott's father. Death Eater.
Leader of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement Squad in the 1920s. Turned the Gaunt family over to the Wizengamot for using magic in front of a Muggle. Died before Harry Potter's sixth year.

Wandmaker and owner of the Ollivanders wand shop. Kidnapped by the Malfoy family for several months until freed by Harry, Ron, and Hermione. His family was known to have been in the wandmaking business since 382 B.C.. It was said that the name means ‘he who owns the olive wand’, which suggested that the original Ollivander arrived in Britain from a Mediterranean country (olive trees not being native to the UK).[3]
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Prefect and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Identical twin sister of Gryffindor student Parvati Patil, and a member of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year and Padma's identical twin sister. Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Death Eater and former Gryffindor student. School friend of James Potter, Sirius Black and Remus Lupin. Betrays Harry's parents James and Lily Potter to Voldemort, resulting in their deaths. Pettigrew is first introduced in the series as Ron Weasley's pet rat Scabbers. He is strangled to death by his own metal prosthetic hand after his loyalty towards Voldemort wavers upon Harry confronting him about having previously spared Pettigrew's life.",
Brother of Cadmus, and Ignotus Peverell. The original owner of the Elder Wand.
Brother of Antioch, and Ignotus Peverell. The original owner of the Resurrection Stone.
Brother of Cadmus, and Antioch Peverell. The original owner of the Invisibility Cloak.
Hogwarts librarian.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Member of the Order of the Phoenix.
Hogwarts school nurse.

Harry Potter's grandmother. Mother of James Potter. When James's best friend, Sirius Black, ran away from home at age sixteen, he found refuge in the Potter household. Euphemia and her husband came to regard Sirius as something of a second son. Advancing in age, both Euphemia and her husband Fleamont succumbed to Dragon Pox shortly after the marriage of their son James. She was among the relatives who Harry saw when he looked into the Mirror of Erised.

Family_affiliation: Potter family, Fleamont family, Peverell family
General_info: Harry Potter's paternal grandfather. Fleamont was born into the wealthy pure-blooded family, to Henry Potter, a prominent Wizengamot member. He was named after his paternal grandmother's maiden name, as it was her dying wish that he perpetuate her maiden name, which would otherwise die out. At some point and per the family tradition, he inherited the Cloak of Invisibility from his father, who was a distant descendant of Ignotus Peverell.

Family_affiliation: Potter family, Evans family, Black family
General_info: Harry James Potter. The main character of the series. The boy who lived. The chosen one. Orphaned son of James and Lily Potter. On his eleventh birthday, Harry learned that he was a wizard, from Rubeus Hagrid. Gryffindor student at Hogwarts, and co-founder and first leader of Dumbledore's Army. The husband of Ginny Weasley, father of James Sirius, Albus Severus and Lily Luna Potter. Harry was also noted for being the only known Master of Death, having united the three Deathly Hallows at the mere age of seventeen. Harry was promoted to Head of the Auror Office at the age of 26 and would occasionally deliver Defence Against the Dark Arts lectures at Hogwarts. He later went on to be Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement

Family_affiliation: Potter family, Evans family, Black family
General_info: Harry Potter's father and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed along with his wife Lily by Lord Voldemort prior to the start of the series.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Slug club
General_info: Muggle-born Gryffindor. Harry Potter's mother and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed by Lord Voldemort. After Hogwarts, Lily married James. Along with their friends Sirius Black, Remus Lupin, and Peter Pettigrew, the couple joined the Order of the Phoenix during the First Wizarding War. She and her husband defied Lord Voldemort himself three times. Shortly afterwards, Lily and James had a son, Harry James Potter, of whom they made Sirius the godfather. However, the family was forced to go into hiding after a prophecy was made concerning Lord Voldemort and their infant son. She and James were betrayed by Pettigrew and thus both were murdered by Voldemort. She learned of her magical nature as a child, after har close friend Severus Snape recognised her as a witch and told her of the existence of magic.

Family_affiliation: Potter family, Evans family, Black family
General_info: Second child of Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley.

Family_affiliation: Potter family, Evans family, Black family
General_info: First child of Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley.

Family_affiliation: Potter family, Evans family, Black family
General_info: Third child of Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley.
Defence Against the Dark Arts professor in Harry Potter's first year. Possessed by Lord Voldemort.
The Grey Lady – Daughter of house founder Rowena Ravenclaw. Stole and hid her mother's diadem, and became Ravenclaw's house ghost after being killed by the Bloody Baron.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and founder of the Ravenclaw house.

Family_affiliation: Riddle family, Lestrange family, Black family
General_info: Daughter of Tom Riddle (Voldemort) and Bellatrix Lestrange. Delphini was born in secret at Malfoy Manor. Euphemia Rowle took Delphi in and raised her, allegedly only because she was offered a substantial amount of gold. Being the only child of Lord Voldemort, she was able to speak Parseltongue. Delphi became the only known living heir of Salazar Slytherin after the demise of her father. Delphini was imprisoned in Azkaban for the murder of Craig Bowker Jr. Exactly like Voldemort and Bellatrix Lestrange, Delphini was intensely sadistic, being easily able to cast the Cruciatus Curse with malicious intent and proving to be a dangerous opponent, even for Harry Potter. Aside from being malicious, Delphini was independent and highly determined, orchestrating a complicated plan to restore Voldemort without any immediate assistance that she didn't gain through manipulating or exploiting other people, something Voldemort himself had possessed. Exactly like Voldemort and Bellatrix Lestrange, Delphini was intensely sadistic, being easily able to cast the Cruciatus Curse with malicious intent and proving to be a dangerous opponent for even Harry Potter. Aside from being malicious, Delphini was independent and highly determined, orchestrating a complicated plan to restore Voldemort without any immediate assistance that she didn't gain through manipulating or exploiting other people, something Voldemort himself had possessed. Delphi was a highly skilful duellist. She quickly defeated the Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement Harry Potter, and it took the combined might of him, Minister for Magic Hermione Granger and seasoned duellists Ronald Weasley and Draco Malfoy to defeat her, showing her proficiency in martial magic.
Thomas Riddle Sr.'s Muggle wife, and Thomas Riddle Jr.'s mother. Killed by her grandson, Lord Voldemort.
Mary's Muggle husband and Thomas Riddle Jr.'s father. Killed by Voldemort.
Voldemort's Muggle father and Merope Gaunt's husband. Killed by his son, Lord Voldemort.
Thomas - Marvolo. Slytherin student who became Lord Voldemort.
Gryffindor student and Quidditch Chaser.
Death Eater and spy working in the Department of Mysteries.
Mother of Minerva, Malcolm and Robert Jr. She married muggle Robert McGonagall. Isobel played as a Quidditch Captain in her youth at Hogwarts
He fought at the Battle of the Astronomy Tower, where he accidentally killed fellow Death Eater Gibbon, burned Rubeus Hagrid's cabin, and tortured Harry Potter.
Ministry of Magic employee whose chief function was as an investigator of alleged Muggle-borns.

Family_affiliation: Scamander family, Lovegood family, Goldstein family
General_info: Son of Luna Lovegood and Rolf Scamander. When his mother travelled to the Patagonian Desert, in Argentina, to attend the final of the 427th Quidditch World Cup, in July 2014, Lorcan was left at home with his grandfather Xenophilius, along with his twin brother, Lysander. Great-grandson of Newt Scamander and Porpentina Goldstein.

Family_affiliation: Scamander family, Lovegood family, Goldstein family
General_info: Son of Luna Lovegood and Rolf Scamander. Twin brother of Lorcan. Great-grandson of Newt Scamander and Porpentina Goldstein.

Newton Scamander. Magizoologist and author of Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. Main character in the Fantastic Beasts film series. Expelled Hogwarts student who excels in curing different sicknesses.

Family_affiliation: Scamander family, Lovegood family, Goldstein family
General_info: Husband of Luna Lovegood. Grandson of Newt Scamander and Porpentina Goldstein. British wizard in the employment of the Daily Prophet who followed the footprints of his famous grandfather and became a magizoologist.
Brother of Newt Scamender. Fiancée of Leta Lestrange. He was involved in WWI and was regarderd a hero.
Head of the Auror Office who replaces Cornelius Fudge as Minister for Magic. Killed by Death Eaters.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Replaces Pius Thicknesse as Minister for Magic.
Conductor of the triple-decker Knight Bus. Jailed in Azkaban on suspicions of being a Death Eater.
Astronomy professor at Hogwarts.
Reporter and tabloid journalist for the Daily Prophet.
Writer, and kin to Wilbert Slinkhard.
Former Hogwarts Potions professor and Head of Slytherin House, whose charges included Tom Riddle. Returned to Hogwarts to teach Potions in Harry's sixth year.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and founder of the Slytherin house. He believed that Muggle-borns should not attend Hogwarts.
Hufflepuff Quidditch Chaser in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Eileen Prince. Mother of Severus Snape. While at school, Eileen was captain of the school Gobstones team during her fifth year.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Death Eater, Slug club
General_info: Potions and later Defence Against the Dark Arts professor at Hogwarts. Head of Slytherin House, and member of both the Death Eaters and the Order of the Phoenix as a double agent spying for Dumbledore. Severus was raised in the Muggle dwelling of Spinner's End, which was in close proximity to the home of the Evans family, though in a poorer area. He met Lily and Petunia Evans when he was nine and fell deeply in love with Lily, becoming a close friend of hers. He both loved Harry Potter, as he reminded him of his childhood friend Lily Evans Potter with whom his remained in love until his end. At the same time he dispised him because he also reminded him of his father, James who was bullying him severely when they were students.Half-Blood Prince.
Muggle father of Severus Snape. He married Eileen Prince.
Gryffindor student two years above Harry. Quidditch Chaser and member of Dumbledore's Army.
Hogwarts Herbology professor and Head of Hufflepuff House.
Minister for Magic while under the Imperius Curse. Replaced by Kingsley Shacklebolt.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Narcissa Malfoy, and the mother of Nymphadora Tonks. Disowned by her family for marrying Muggle-born Ted Tonks.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Nymphadora Lupin. Ted and Andromeda's daughter. Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. She marries Remus Lupin and becomes the mother of a son, Teddy, before she and Remus are killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.
Andromeda's Muggle-born husband, and the father of Nymphadora Tonks. Killed by Snatchers.
Hogwarts Divination professor. Predicted the prophecy that prompted Lord Voldemort to go after the Potters.
Husband of Leonie Tremblay.
Father of Bernard
Grandson of Falco I.
Wife of Bernard Ttremblay. had two children with him, daughter Clarisse and son Falco.
Hogwarts Apparition instructor who works in the Department of Magical Transportation.

Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic, Hogwarts High Inquisitor and temporary Headmistress of Hogwarts. She becomes Defence Against the Dark Arts professor in Harry Potter's fifth year, and joins in the persecution of half-bloods and Muggle-borns under Voldemort. Sentenced to life imprisonment in Azkaban.
Husband of Minerva McGonagall. He accidentally died from a venomous tentacula bite.

Member_of: Order of the Phoenix, Advance Guard
General_info: Member of the Order of the Phoenix and of the Advance Guard that retrieved Harry Potter from 4 Privet Drive and escorted him to 12 Grimmauld Place. Killed by Death Eaters.
Gryffindor student who unsuccessfully tries to romance Harry.
Arithmancy professor at Hogwarts.
He who must not be named. You know who. The villain of the series. Murderer of Harry Potter's parents and many others in his quest for immortality and absolute power.
Moaning Myrtle – Muggle-born Ravenclaw student during Tom Riddle's time at Hogwarts. Killed by the Basilisk in a girls' bathroom, which she continued to haunt after her death.
Muggle-obsessed Ministry of Magic employee, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Husband of Molly Weasley, father of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny Weasley.
Oldest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Gringotts employee. Marries Fleur Delacour. Father of Victoire Weasley.
Second son of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Member of the Order of the Phoenix. Works with dragons in Romania.

Family_affiliation: Weasley family, Delacour family, Prewett family
General_info: Daughter of Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour.

Son of Arthur and Molly Weasley and identical twin brother of George Weasley. Gryffindor Quidditch Beater and member of Dumbledore's Army, later co-owner of joke shop Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Son of Arthur and Molly Weasley and identical twin brother of Fred Weasley. Gryffindor Quidditch Beater and member of Dumbledore's Army. Co-owner of Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. He fought in the Battle of Hogwarts in 1998, during which he lost his twin brother Fred.

Ginevra Weasley. Only daughter and youngest child of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Gryffindor student one year below Harry, Quidditch Seeker and Chaser, and member of Dumbledore's Army. Ginny is the wife of Harry Potter. She caught Professor Slughorn's attention when she cast the seemingly difficult Bat-Bogey Hex. Professional Quidditch player for the Holyhead Harpies. Upon retiring from the Harpies, she became the senior Quidditch correspondent for the Daily Prophet.
Son of Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, brother of Rose Weasley.

Family_affiliation: Weasley family, Delacour family, Prewett family
General_info: Son of Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour.
Wife of Arthur Weasley and mother of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny. Member of the Order of the Phoenix.

Percy Ignatius Weasley. Third son of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Gryffindor prefect and Head Boy, then Ministry of Magic employee, during which he becomes estranged from his family before joining them in fighting the Death Eaters in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Ronald Bilius Weasley. Youngest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley who is best friends with Harry Potter. Husband of Hermione Granger. Gryffindor Quidditch Keeper, prefect, and co-founder of Dumbledore's Army. He skipped his last year of school in order to accompany Harry and Hermione on a hunt to destroy all of Lord Voldemort's Horcruxes. fought in the Battle of Hogwarts in 1998, during which he lost his brother Fred. After the war, Ron became an Auror and helped reform and revolutionise the Ministry of Magic. After two years as an Auror, he went to work at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes with his brother George. He is the godfather of James Sirius Potter.
Gryffindor Quidditch Keeper and captain four years above Harry.
Because he was considered to be a blood traitor by the Black family, his wife Cedrella was removed from the Black family tree.

Family_affiliation: Weasley family, Delacour family, Prewett family
General_info: Daughter of Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour. Victoire is the last character introduced during the Harry Potter series
Daughter of Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger. Sister of Hugo Weasley.
Writer of Blood Brothers: My Life Amongst the Vampires.
Death Eater. Head of Magical Law Enforcement under Voldemort's regime. Yaxley did not search for Voldemort after his first downfall, but this was forgiven after Voldemort's return.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. His mother was a beautiful witch who has wedded and been widowed at least seven times, thus inheriting a great deal of wealth from her former husbands.
